text: Welcome to today's chemistry class. We'll be learning about chemical reactions and their different types.
A chemical reaction occurs when substances interact to form new compounds with different properties.
There are four main types of chemical reactions: combination, decomposition, displacement, and double displacement.
In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form a single product.
Decomposition reactions involve breaking down a compound into simpler substances.
Displacement reactions occur when a more reactive element displaces a less reactive one.
Today we explore acids, bases and salts. Acids are substances that release hydrogen ions in water.
Bases are substances that release hydroxide ions. The pH scale helps us measure acidity.
Common acids include hydrochloric acid, sulfuric acid, and nitric acid.
Indicators like litmus paper help us identify acids and bases by color changes.
